# Terms of Service

## Terms of Use - Terms of Service

**Effective Date: April 13, 2023**

These Terms of Service (these "Terms of Service") explain the terms and conditions by which you may access and use the Products provided by Stripe (as defined below). "Products" means the various features, content, services and functions available through the Platform that enable you to use API Services (as defined below). These Products are provided by Stripe, Inc. and its affiliated companies ("Stripe," "we," "our" and "us").

By accessing or using any of the Products, you are entering into a binding contract with Stripe. You acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by the terms and conditions contained in these Terms of Service. These Terms of Service also include the Stripe Platform Privacy and Cookie Policy and any other applicable Terms in relation to your use of the API Services (each as may be amended or updated from time to time).

If you do not understand or do not wish to be bound by these Terms of Service, you should not access or use the Products. BY ACCESSING, BROWSING OR OTHERWISE USING THE PRODUCTS, YOU ACKNOWLEDGE THAT YOU HAVE READ, UNDERSTOOD AND AGREE TO BE BOUND BY THESE TERMS OF SERVICE. THE LEGAL AGE FOR ENTERING INTO A CONTRACT IN APPLICABLE LAW IS IN YOUR COUNTRY (THE "LEGAL AGE"). IF YOU DO NOT MEET THE MINIMUM AGE REQUIREMENT TO USE THE PLATFORM OR IF YOU HAVE PREVIOUSLY BEEN SUSPENDED OR REMOVED FROM THE PLATFORM BY LEGAL GUARDIAN MUST AGREE TO THE PLATFORM TERMS. IF YOU DO NOT KNOW WHETHER YOU HAVE THE LEGAL ABILITY TO ACCEPT THESE TERMS OF SERVICE, PLEASE ASK YOUR LEGAL GUARDIAN, OR DO NOT USE THE PRODUCTS OR ACCESS THE PLATFORM. BY USING ANY OF THE PRODUCTS, YOU REPRESENT AND WARRANT THAT: (A) ALL REGISTRATION INFORMATION YOU SUBMIT IS TRUTHFUL AND ACCURATE; (B) YOU WILL MAINTAIN THE ACCURACY OF SUCH INFORMATION; (C) YOUR USE OF THE PRODUCTS DOES NOT VIOLATE ANY APPLICABLE LAW OR REGULATION; AND (D) THAT YOU MEET THESE AGE REQUIREMENTS. IF YOUR USE OF THE ACCOUNT OR COMPANY'S SERVICE VIOLATES THESE TERMS OF SERVICE, STRIPE MAY IMMEDIATELY TERMINATE YOUR APPLICATION OR SUSPEND YOUR ACCOUNT.

---

## 2. ACCOUNT

2.1 Usage of the Tools requires an account registered with Stripe in connection with the Platform ("Account"). By creating an Account through the Platform, you agree to: (a) maintain the security of your Account by not sharing your password with others and restricting access to your Account; (b) promptly notify Stripe if you discover or otherwise suspect any security breaches related to the Platform or your Account; and (c) take responsibility for all activities that occur under your Account and accept all risks of unauthorized access.

2.2 Stripe may, in its sole and absolute discretion, accept or reject any application for an Account and/or suspend or terminate any Account that it deems to have violated any of these Terms of Service or the policies referenced herein. Stripe may do so at any time and for any reason, without prior notice to you. Account activity and access will be governed by these Terms of Service.

2.3 You must at all times maintain the security and prevent the misuse of your Account, and any assigned keys or other credentials used to authenticate your Account access, as well as access to all of your systems, devices and communications. You agree to comply with and cause your Users to comply with, as applicable, the PCI Data Security Standard as it applies to you and your activities and to comply with applicable obligations under the Card Association and Network Rules (as applicable) for safeguarding the security of your Account, emergency keys or other credentials that have been provided to you.

2.4 Each User of the Account is separately responsible for maintaining the confidentiality and appropriate use of any credentials provided to use the Account. You are fully responsible and liable for all uses of your Account and for any actions that take place using your Account, whether or not such actions were taken by you. Stripe has no obligation to verify that the person accessing or using your Account is you.

2.5 You acknowledge and agree that: (i) you shall not be responsible for, and bound by, any and all actions and use of the Platform made using your Account, whether or not you have authorized such use; (ii) you will not sell, transfer or sublicense your Account rights to any other entity without Stripe's prior written consent; (iii) you are responsible for all activity associated with your Account; and (iv) you are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your Account and password (if enforcement, bans, ordinances, rules, laws, rules, regulations, notifications, guidelines, directives, directives and orders of all applicable United States federal, state and local governments and governmental agencies and bodies, and by the laws of and orders of the governments of any jurisdiction from which you access the Platform that may apply to you. Stripe may assume that any communications we receive under your Account have been made by you. If you become aware of any unauthorized use of your Account, you must notify Stripe immediately at the email address noted in Section 12 below.

---

## 3. PLATFORM

3.1 The Platform provides you with the ability to access and use certain software, applications and services (collectively, the "Platform") in order to use the APIs offered by Stripe (the "API Services").

3.2 You may only access and use the Platform and the Tools to create, distribute and use software applications, websites or online services (each, an "Application") that interacts with Stripe's API Services to provide payment-related functionality to persons who use Shopee Services in a manner which is in accordance with these Terms of Service, the Shopee Third-party Service Terms (https://shopee.sg/legaldoc/terms) and the Application Data, Use Policies as those Terms of Service are published to the Platform from time to time (together, the "Developer Terms").

3.3 In connection with your use of the Platform, the API Services and/or any Application, you and any person acting on your behalf (including your employees, personnel, subcontractors, agents, principals, contractors and subcontractors ("Users"), as applicable) shall: (a) not directly or indirectly (i) reverse engineer, reverse compile, disassemble or otherwise attempt to discover the source code, object code or underlying structure, ideas, know-how or algorithms of the API Services or any API Documentation (defined below); (ii) modify, translate or create derivative works based on the API Services, the Platform or any API Documentation; or (iii) use the API Services in a manner that: (A) is contrary to applicable law or regulation; (B) violates the rights (including the rights of privacy or publicity, or Intellectual Property Rights) of others; (C) is harmful, fraudulent, threatening, abusive, harassing, tortious, defamatory, vulgar, obscene, libelous, invasive of another's privacy, or promotes discrimination, bigotry, racism, hatred, harassment or harm; or (D) transmits, displays, distributes or otherwise makes available any harmful, offensive or inappropriate content (including offensive or inappropriate material ("Prohibited Material").

3.4 You will not access or use the Platform or the Tools for any purpose that is beyond the scope of the authorization and access granted to you or do anything which violates the terms set forth in these Terms of Service. In particular, you will not do, attempt to do or authorize or permit any third party to do any of the following, except as expressly permitted in these Terms of Service: (a) license, sell, rent, lease, transfer, distribute, publish, sublicense or otherwise make available the API Services or any API Documentation to any third party or allow any third party to use the same, except that you may permit the use of the API Services by your Users (as defined below); (b) reproduce or make unauthorized copies of the Platform or the Tools; (c) decompile, disassemble, reverse engineer or otherwise attempt to derive the source code for the Platform or the Tools; (d) access or use the Platform or the API Services in order to monitor their availability, performance or functionality or for any similar benchmarking purposes; (e) use the Platform, the Tools or any communications sent through or in connection with the Platform for transmission of any data, including personal data, and data sets that include personal links, and areas not include information that violate the Data Use Policy, any other Stripe terms or policies, or applicable data protection laws; (f) circumvent or disable any technological features or measures of the Platform or the Tools for security or protection of Intellectual Property Rights; (g) attempt to decipher, decompile, disassemble or reverse engineer any of the software used to provide the Platform or the Tools, or in any way alter, modify or create derivative works based on the Platform, the Tools or any communications sent through or in connection with the Platform; (h) use any robot, spider, site search/retrieval application or other manual or automatic device or process to retrieve, index, "scrape," "data mine" or in any way reproduce or circumvent the navigational structure or presentation of the Platform; (i) use any meta tags or other "hidden text" utilizing Stripe's name, trademarks, or product names; (j) conduct any other activity that may damage, disable, overburden or impair the Platform; (k) harvest, collect or gather User data without the User's consent; (l) use the Application, the Platform and the Tools in a manner that overburdens or harms the Platform or the Stripe's systems or network, such as through denial-of-service-type attacks, including any attempt to probe, scan or test the vulnerability of a system or network or to breach security or authentication measures; or (m) access or use the Application, the API Services, the Platform or the Tools in order to build a competitive product or service, or copy any features, functions or graphics.

3.5 You agree to cooperate with Stripe to prevent the unauthorized use of the Application and/or the Platform and you agree to promptly notify Stripe in the event any become aware of any unauthorized use. In the event that a circumstance arises including but not limited to (a) suspected fraudulent activity affecting your use of the API (for example, by making the number of API calls in excess of the limits communicated to you by Stripe for your Account), or (b) if Stripe discovers, or receives a report regarding actual or suspected unauthorized use or disclosure of data, Content or information derived from your use of the Platform or the API Services by your Users (such as usage through your Application (any such actual events called "improper Activity"), Stripe may (i) suspend access to the Application, the API Services, the Platform and/or the Tools immediately pending a full investigation; (ii) disable, suspend or close your Account; and/or (iii) remove any Content you made available (as applicable). You will reasonably cooperate with Stripe's investigation of any Improper Activity.

3.6 You may not use, provide or permit use of the Platform or the Tools to access, or transmit through the Platform or the Tools, any data that is protected by law (for example, payment card data covered by the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) or personal data governed by applicable data protection laws).

3.7 Stripe reserves the right at any time to ensure such terms and conditions (i) it deems appropriate in relation to the use of any Application; (ii) it deems as necessary or desirable in order to maintain the safety, security and performance of the Application, the Platform, the API Services and the Tools, and their systems; or (iii) as may be required by Applicable Law.

3.8 The use of the Tools may require open source software, which shall be subject to a separate license agreement between you and the owner(s) of the open source software and may provide additional rights to you. Unless otherwise agreed by Stripe, such open source software is licensed to you on an "AS-IS" BASIS, without any warranties or conditions of any kind. Stripe assumes no liability or responsibility for the open source software, and Stripe makes no representation or warranty with respect to such open source software. Stripe does not provide any indemnity to the extent of any inconsistency and liability with respect to the open source software incorporated into the Platform or the Tools.

5.8 You acknowledge and agree that you are solely responsible for the contents of any Application developed by you in connection with the Platform and the Tools and you will be solely responsible for all liabilities, claims, suits and expenses arising out of or resulting from the contents of your transmissions or communications through the Platform.

5.10 You represent and warrant that you will not upload, post, email or otherwise transmit any Application material or content that infringes any patent, trademark, trade secret, copyright or other proprietary rights ("Intellectual Property Rights") of any person or entity.

## 8. DATA PROTECTION

8.1 In using any of the Platform and the Tools, you consent to Shopee's collection, use and disclosure of your personal data, which is processed in accordance with Shopee's Privacy Policy.

8.3 To the extent Personal Information is shared by Shopee with you, you hereby agree to take reasonable steps for protection and processing of personal data or privacy, including where applicable the guidance and codes of practice issued by the relevant data protection commissioner or Singapore, or other relevant Relevant Bodies.

8.4 You shall not and shall take reasonable steps to ensure that your Personnel do not use the Personal Information for collecting users; disclosing or processing their personal data; or

(i) transmitting or disclosing their personal data to third parties, whether located within or outside Singapore;

(b) unforeseen circumstances preventing the proper performance of the Platform despite any reasonable precautions taken by Shopee. Such circumstances include (but are not limited to, act of God (such as, but not limited to, fires, explosions, earthquakes, and floods), power outage, internet interruption or failure, hacking attack and unusually high levels of use which have the effect of causing slowdown or delay in the Platform;

(c) corruption, error or loss of any data or information stored on or transmitted by the Platform. Shopee accepts no liability for verifying its contents;

(d) any system, server or connection failure, error, omission, interruption, delay in transmission, computer virus or other malicious, destructive or corrupting code, agent program or macros; and

(e) any use of or access to any other website or webpage linked to the Platform, even if advised of, or having contemplated, the possibility of such liability.

## 12. INDEMNITIES

12.1 To the fullest extent permitted by the Applicable Laws, you agree to indemnify and hold harmless the Shopee Indemnitees from and against all Losses arising out of or relating to your use of the Platform, including (but not limited to):

(a) any access or use of any of the Platform and the Tools referable to your Account;

(b) your Applications;

(c) your User Materials;

(d) your actual or alleged breach of any of the Platform Terms and your actual or alleged infringement of any third party right of any nature whatsoever; and

(e) your negligent or wilful conduct.

Shopee will give you prompt notice of any Losses, however failure to provide such notice shall not relieve you of your liabilities or obligations hereunder, except solely to the extent of any material prejudice as a direct result of such failure.

12.2 To the fullest extent permitted by the Applicable Laws, you agree to:

(a) defend Shopee against any third-party legal proceeding and pay damages finally awarded to such third party and against Shopee or pay any settlement agreed to by Shopee as a result of and to the extent attributable to a third party claim that: (i) arises from your Applications and/or User Materials infringe the Intellectual Property Right of a third party; or (ii) arises from your breach of the Platform Terms; and

(b) cooperate fully in the defence of any third-party legal proceeding.

12.3 Notwithstanding the foregoing, Shopee reserves the right to control its own defense and follow such course of action at it reasonably deems necessary to protect its interests, and you shall fully indemnify Shopee for all costs (including legal fees and settlement payments) reasonably incurred in such course of action.

## 13. HYPERLINKS, ALERTS AND ADVERTISING

13.1 For your convenience, Shopee may include hyperlinks to other websites or content on the internet that are owned or operated by third parties. Such linked websites or content are not under the control of Shopee and Shopee shall not be liable for any errors, omissions, delays, defamation, libel, slander, falsehood, obscenity, pornography, profanity, inaccuracy or any other objectionable material contained in the contents, or the consequences of accessing, any linked website. Any hyperlink to any other websites or content are not an endorsement or verification of such websites or content and you agree that your access to or use of such linked websites or content is entirely at your own risk.

13.2 Shopee may attach banners, java applets and such other materials to the Platform for the purposes of advertising any products or services of Shopee or certain third parties. For the avoidance of doubt, you shall not be entitled to receive any payment, fee or commission in respect of any such advertising or other promotional materials.

## 14. TERMINATION

14.1 Shopee may, from time to time, without giving any reason or notice, and without any liability, (i) disable, suspend, or terminate your Account, access to the Platform, the Tools and any part thereof, or (ii) terminate these Terms of Service, with immediate effect.

14.2 Upon the termination of these Terms of Service for any reason:

(a) your Account and all licences granted under these Terms will automatically terminate with immediate effect;

(b) you shall delete or destroy all copies of Shopee Content and personal data in your possession within fourteen (14) days, and provide written proof of such deletion or destruction to Shopee upon request; and

(c) you shall take all reasonable steps requested by Shopee in making an orderly transition to ensure that Shopee Users who are using your Applications are not prejudiced.

14.3 Termination of these Terms of Service for any reason shall not affect any rights, remedies, obligations, or liabilities that have accrued up to the date of termination, including the right to claim damages in respect of any breach, including any breach of the Platform Terms, that occurred before or on the date of termination.

## 15. GOVERNING LAW AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION

15.1 These Terms of Service shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Singapore Any dispute, controversy, difference or claim arising out of or relating to these Terms of Service, including the existence, validity, interpretation, performance, breach or termination thereof or the consequences of its nullity and any dispute, controversy, difference or relating to it shall be referred to and finally resolved by arbitration administered by the Singapore International Arbitration Centre ("SIAC") under the SIAC Administered Arbitration Rules in force when the Notice of Arbitration is submitted. The seat of arbitration shall be Singapore. The number of arbitrators shall be one. The arbitration proceedings shall be conducted in English.

## 16. GENERAL

16.1 Nothing in these Terms of Service shall constitute a partnership, joint venture or principal-agent relationship between you and Shopee, nor does it authorise you to incur any costs or liabilities on Shopee's behalf.

16.2 The failure of Shopee at any time or times to require performance of any provision hereof shall in no manner affect its right at a later time to enforce the same unless the same is waived in writing.

16.3 These Terms of Service are solely for your and our benefit and are not for the benefit of any other person or entity, except for Shopee's affiliates and subsidiaries (and each of Shopee's and its affiliates' and subsidiaries' respective successors and assigns).

16.4 If for any reason any provision of these Terms of Service and any agreements and policies included or referred to in these Terms o Service (or part of any provision) is or becomes, at any time, to any extent, invalid, illegal or unenforceable, such provision shall not supersede any previous agreement or understanding between the parties in relation to such subject matter. The parties also hereby exclude all implied terms in fact. In entering into the agreement formed by these Terms of Service, the parties have not relied on any statement, representation, warranty, understanding, undertaking, promise or assurance of any person else than as expressly set out in these Terms of Service. Each party, irrevocably and unconditionally waives all claims, rights and remedies which but for this Section it might otherwise have had in relation to any of the foregoing. These Terms of Service may not be contradicted, explained or supplemented by evidence of any prior agreement, any contemporaneous oral agreement or any consistent additional terms.

16.5 You agree to comply with all applicable laws, statutes, regulations and codes relating to anti-bribery and corruption including without limitation the UK Bribery Act, the US Foreign Corrupt Practices Act and the Singapore Prevention of Corruption Act and confirm that you have and shall have in place all policies and procedures needed to ensure compliance with such requirements.

16.6 If you have any questions or concerns about these Terms of Service or any issues raised in these Terms of Service or on the site, please contact us at: legal@support.shopee.sg

## 17. LEGAL NOTICES (PLEASE READ)

LEGAL NOTICES (PLEASE READ BEFORE USING Shopee.com and Attention it to the "General Counsel"

metadata.title: Terms of Service
metadata.summary: This document outlines the Terms of Service for accessing and using Stripe's Products and API Services. It details the responsibilities of users, account management, and acceptable use of the platform, emphasizing compliance with legal and security standards.
use_cases: Understanding the legal agreement before using Stripe's services.
Managing user accounts and ensuring security.
Complying with API usage guidelines and restrictions.
Developing applications that integrate with Stripe's API Services.
Ensuring compliance with PCI Data Security Standard.
